name: reconvince
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to persuade someone again or make someone certain again, for the second, third, etc. time: It took us days to reconvince the authorities. After this defeat, the team will need some re-convincing of their title chances.
More examplesFewer examplesShe went door to door, slowly re-convincing voters to have faith in the party once again.When you love somebody, no one can reconvince you not to love.Each time I went back I had to reconvince them to give me an interview.
